C5D9E3B16D3B45D2B725C2F7B6538944.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

D643C8B66B624D2B86761D48C4CECA6C.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

EBB49A06CBD241BBB191F8A3DB46A000.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

A1B7813B5B084A74999BC8884358E0AC.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

4352736E41C645D390C084F483AA3F62.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

6579A3FDCAB14E63B14502928E788AF7.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

29731FCEBE8C466FB9DB7C649A2906CA.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

C39A33B96B5D42558F6367C215AC08AD.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

9A4C6BAFF6AB4FD884138D13B2159EE5.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

17BAD36D87D241659D6AF5FEF25ACF73.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

DEF515BCB3DF4FD6B37C2C4F28109FF4.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

FD5926877E594841AE67D736AD13A3AB.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

0E84CC33113145A8B36CD40AB90E9203.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

FEC8C2D9D4CE47A692A5F4F512B95A4A.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: • What is my schedule of work hours? • Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative? Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?,  What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

A47B618C634A4E5FB50A2864A69507E1.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

8B9869718A7045DB99A80F53D700BE7C.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; • guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

CA9DB2C1ACA947608BAC6CADFCC90674.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

B324273FA2964B05A076F83C414079FD.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

CA29C802921144048BC97B1EF8D52CAD.description: Examine the availability of, and compensation associated with, several leaves (e.g., sick, disability, maternity, parental and leave of absence) in a variety of work settings in Saskatchewan.

03B6A01F2D1C48C2A7049F99D15B73A6.description: Investigate leaves from work in Saskatchewan and their potential impact on finances.

4C06F21E9C164CAD8E7F0F1A0D7878A8.description: Discuss how one’s career path may involve multiple occupations or job loss (e.g., due to natural disaster, economic downturns, layoffs or medical issues) that require resilience and adaptability to overcome.

D3434D6F05514DCD8E42F37A1CCCA44F.description: Investigate advantages and disadvantages (e.g., flexibility of hours, worker benefits and sick days) associated with one’s chosen career.

DA994C13F98540B99F2655F07F1ED600.description: Suggest ways to reduce expenses associated with one’s desired future lifestyle.

D98FAB2184094B75842E5BF04F07054E.description: Suggest opportunities (e.g., side businesses, e-commerce, buy-and-sells, odd jobs, raises, promotions and bonuses) for earning additional income to support one’s desired future lifestyle

E72E061BCFF745DAB35574854425AD37.description: Discuss ways (e.g., increase income and reduce expenses) to align the earning potential of one’s chosen career with the costs associated with one’s desired future lifestyle.

21F2E1C662CC4E3F9FAAFD8847A4915A.description: Compare the earning potential of one’s chosen career to the costs associated with one’s desired future lifestyle

478419E3CBD14FD79C07953F7103FD97.description: Evaluate the viability of one’s chosen career to support one’s desired future lifestyle.

C8CBD56B3B8E4061B9D810F6E6922541.description: Explore the role of an income tax specialist (e.g., an accountant) in helping individuals and businesses make sound financial decisions to minimize taxes.

588AC57273DE49859ACBB3BEA6C1DF38.description: Complete an income tax return for self or for various scenarios.

A658495900374BD6B238F00B54683C49.description: Research how various sources of income are taxed differently and at different rates.

B3E175473B7E41B8937D7CD9BDD79198.description: List the sources of income on which income tax is levied, including: wages/salaries; interest, dividends and capital gains; self-employment; property rental; royalties on intellectual property; and, other incomes such as alimony, prizes or gambling winnings.

8B99FA59BA614144AB9E8230E6BBFCCF.description: Discuss benefits and credits such as the Goods and Services Tax (GST) credit, child tax benefit and working income tax benefit.

3B82CF7EC2204132A809C909BB17AD03.description: Differentiate between a tax credit (e.g., basic personal amount, dependent children and tuition and education amounts) and a tax deduction (e.g., child care expenses and Registered Retirement Savings Plan contribution).

6402083AC5DE4BD187558D998DAA39C0.description: Compare marginal and effective tax rates.

84C194831E1744018F21468EBBA66A74.description: Describe the relationship between tax brackets and tax rates.

6478105D0B4A4EA2BA5ACDC5484E8C11.description: Recognize the purpose of a Social Insurance Number (SIN) with respect to income tax.

A48F3D1EA6A440FEBBAD99ABDC30F698.description: Determine an individual’s responsibilities with respect to filing and paying income tax

88645C7A974D4B798177E94DBFA5F5CF.description: Investigate the economic impact of First Nations in Saskatchewan and Canada, and the resulting benefits for all people (e.g., treaty education outcome TR10 - Examine contemporary economic implications of Treaties for all the people of Saskatchewan and other Canadian jurisdictions).

A0A2F68E5F994CEDB4986FF157D302CD.description: Investigate tax obligations and exemptions for First Nations individuals and businesses

57122DA677124987B98A7AC0F9B6FBE9.description: Discuss the impact of pervading misconceptions related to First Nations communities and the tax system.

8D3C2243C8144D2489E9F1A6037942C2.description: Research myths (e.g., First Nations people do not pay taxes and postsecondary education is free) and facts (e.g., income earned off reserve is taxed and goods bought off reserve are subject to Goods and Services Tax and Provincial Sales Tax) about First Nations people and taxes.

6083CE3F6E4F4A69851C24E433CBDA52.description: Examine the relationship between taxation and First Nations people in Saskatchewan and Canada.

B43A40835A384AB0A2DFD16B4A14F53C.description: Investigate financial obligations associated with treaties (e.g., treaty education outcome TR10 - Examine contemporary economic implications of Treaties for all the people of Saskatchewan and other Canadian jurisdictions).

3BFE54EB3D944433AA5FE23246D78CC4.description: Investigate eligibility criteria for a variety of government programs (e.g., tax benefits, welfare, employment insurance, grants and subsidized housing).

71C419359CF44076A8129F72CF0A2527.description: Investigate risks associated with over-reliance on sources of income such as lotteries, gambling and pawn shops.

8706D166BDA04BDA9F8076F280C1C834.description: Explain the purpose and function of a pension.

3089E5E39A6947A883C50E7B2260C4DD.description: Discuss how an inheritance may contribute to personal, family or community finances.

8C96F369D31B40219C7A0420EAF199FC.description: Examine the roles of provincial (e.g., Financial Consumer Affairs Authority) and federal (e.g., Canadian Securities Administrators) organizations in protecting investors.

92841AFA34F64987A400940CD1E8037D.description: Research the advantages and disadvantages of obtaining financial advice from sources such as the Internet, friends and family.

F5CEEF8DEC1E4E0FB59A4AADDB8FF799.description: Pose questions related to various scenarios that could be answered by a financial professional/advisor.

B41F1FE86D1948589C4ECC71E83E1361.description: Discuss ways to find credible financial advice.

1FAD28B7B91B4F21A87A1CD47A6E630D.description: Discuss how various cultural communities obtain financial advice.

1B7DDCCDA06C4D1B9D3B228917851FA5.description: Identify financial industry professionals/advisors in one’s community.

1082350D873140E7BC4E28893F939F0D.description: Research the accreditation required by professionals in the financial industry in Saskatchewan.

1A19B304F46441ECAAECEDD6904D5CE1.description: Investigate how various financial professionals are paid and earn a living.

A7BB394F532A445C88A9A8AADE737C51.description: Identify various roles in the financial industry such as financial planners, securities dealers and advisors, portfolio managers, insurance brokers, loans officers and accountants.

ADF69E72786E4CB3AA9409CCF9C4DCA9.description: Assess how to find credible sources of financial advice.

4CD294E81EAC49D188E349F6E5660012.description: Identify financial institutions whose services best meet the needs for self or various scenarios.

883206EA9F294ECB987CD78F2E71F368.description: Compare services, products and fees for clients of different age groups (e.g., children, youth, adults and seniors) associated with various financial institutions.

2A0288920D4B42AEB34F8798F1CD48E2.description: Research the similarities and differences (e.g., ownership structures, profit vs. non-profit and federally vs. provincially regulated) between a bank and a credit union.

5C7A7F8ED4A24451905C972AC759C0EF.description: Compare services provided by various financial institutions including those responsive to various cultures (e.g., First Nations Bank of Canada, Indigenous credit unions, Habib Canadian Bank and Bank of China-- Canada).

62FA3182C0804123A477C690F6735DF5.description: Assess factors that influence the selection of a financial institution.

96BF9299E3EB4434B858E5F742EC2946.description: Financial Institutions - Personal Application and Function (Core)

0F9469E9F5F84EA5AF65CDAA08B0B18F.description: Reflect on the effectiveness of a spending plan and suggest adjustments to achieve changing and evolving goals.

BFA0D233C99E4B9ABB88FADE58819CB6.description: Modify an existing spending plan to account for changing conditions.

ABB5CD4AB2FB48C3A4F353A80E9A3DEB.description: Discuss reasons why adjustments to income and expenses for a personal spending plan may be necessary.

85D4CE9776194391B9154358A9E14538.description: Discuss the impact of changing circumstances (e.g., moving, employment, unemployment, underemployment, economic conditions and lifestyle choices) on a spending plan.

F62936C61D1249B5A858164AB82942C5.description: Create a spending plan that projects an individual’s income and expenses for a minimum of three to five years following high school.

6EE4BB6C37324524AC7A9FA91CDB3E11.description: Compare the financial implications of different post-secondary education and training or work options.

6C646FDC25154C5A933E726ED0B403C6.description: Create and implement a spending plan based on a fictional scenario or confidential personal plan.

836A5767F8F74BD6A2D1B9842458525A.description: Create and evaluate a fictional or confidential personal spending plan.
